message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

This paper focuses on improving the broadcast propagation in blockchain networks, which involves network infrastructure and communication protocols. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses the use of tree structures to organize network nodes and message propagation, which falls under the category of distributed computing (cs.DC). The paper also addresses security concerns related to blockchain forks, which could be classified under the category of cryptography (cs.CR). Additionally, the paper proposes a new method for message propagation, which could be considered as a contribution to the field of data structures (cs.DS) and social and information networks (cs.SI).
